page.title: 16STORNOWAY S. GATHERING PEATS
page.content: A DAY AT THE PEATS: I was woken at about 7.30 am, put on my old jeans, thick jumper, boban socks and wellies. After breakfast my mother, father and I drove the 8 miles to Gress where my Granny had made a little picnic. My uncle and cousins were coming up as well. We then drove up the Tolsta road. When we got to the peat banks all the adults waited for the tractor to come. (Weeks before the peat had been cut and then turned to dry). When the tractor came they sterted filling the trailer. (Peat is like hardened mud but will easily crumble in your hands). When the trailer was full the driver took it back to my Granny's, tipped out the peats and went back for more. Meanwhile my grandpa was stacking the peats near the house for use in the winter. At the end of the day we all had a big meal at Granny's.
